climbs.name: Watercolor Wall
climbs.fa: Bill Dockins & Kristen Drumheller(August '86). Lower half aided by David Gerhart prior to free ascent.

content.description: Wonderful climbing on "beautiful, polychromatic" lichen covered rock!
content.protection: Tricams .5 & 1 helpful at the start but not mandatory. RP's, stoppers, SLCDs .1-#2. Two bolt chain anchor, same as for Still Life and Dream Imagery.
content.location: Right of Still Life. Begin on a left leaning thin crack, marvel at a rusty fixed RURP then straight up following the weakness.

content.description: Start near the furthest uphill northfacing wall on Tango Tower on a small ledge 25' uphill of Hjelt's sport climb. A 10' V3 boulder problem over a pile of boulders is protected by a low bolt. It then gains a finger-lock and first gear placement. A few more feet of jams gets one over a lip and the entrance to 50' of 5.8 traditional face-climbing (a bit lichen covered).
content.protection: One bolt. Stoppers to 2.5". Chain anchors.

climbs.name: Still Life
climbs.fa: P. Kingsbury, J. Apple, T. Kingsbury, T. Williams  june 2007

content.description: Starting uphill from the 'watercolor', begin with underclings behind a tree and work up and right. Thin face climbing above minimal and marginal gear leads to a hollow dihedral where one wants to traverse into the watercolor for the last 10' to the anchors.
content.protection: Thin gear up to a #2 Friend. Spicy.
content.location: Uphill from the watercolor and just right of Djajs sport route.

content.description: This is a gem that was buried under some crispy flakes and crumbly crimps but has cleaned up. Stick clip first bolt! Start on undercling, climb straight up following bolts. Really good sustained movement through amazing rock.
content.location: Between Oh, my Gouache! and Still Life.

content.description:
AKA Hjelt's sport route.

The left-most bolted line on the wall. Excellent rock quality and good clipping holds.

Hard crux in the middle, but the bolt is at your waist and the fall is clean.
content.location: About 20' right from the uphill edge of Tango Tower. ~200 feet uphill of the Fugitive.

climbs.name: The Fugitive
climbs.fa: Bill Dockins, Kristen Drumheller, Tom Kalakay, May 1986

content.description: The best line in the Canyon . . . Climb discontinuous finger cracks on a beautiful piece of stone. Grip it and rip it!
content.protection: Gear to 2". Heavy on nuts and fingers. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Located on the lowest tier of Tango Tower, directly off the main trail with a ballin' belay seat.

content.description: Start at base of "The Pagan".  Head straight up on pink rock, staying on edgy face with decent gear. Aim for the left-facing corner with a 3' roof guarding the entrance. Enter corner from the left after placing a few good pieces below roof. The corner extends for 20' up to chain anchors.
content.location: In the Pagan alcove at the uphill terminus of Tango Tower.

climbs.name: Dream Imagery
climbs.fa: Alex Lowe, Scott Wade & David Gerhart '86

content.description: The clean splitting, left leaning crack system that mirrors the arete of the wall until it meets with Watercolor. Good jammin' and lichen smearin'.
content.protection: Stoppers and Cams .2 - #2 or #3. Same bolted anchor with chain as for Still Life and Watercolor.
content.location: Belay from a trodden mossy ledge. Downhill of Watercolor.
